candidate.name: Shuo-Yang Wang
candidate.location: New York, New York, United States

experiences.description:
GDPR privacy dashboard (July 2017 - current)
GDPR privacy dashboard is a dashboard for end users. According to the latest EU regulation, tech companies are required to let EU users know what data from users is collected by the company, including a user's direct data (such as first name and last name) and derived data (for example, the data that Yahoo knows John is a Warriors fan, which is derived from John's browsing history). GDPR is the dashboard (webpage) to display the information of what user data is collected by Yahoo.
I work on JAVA backend for this project, and also need to deal with pipeline deployment, authentication, authorization, and access control problems for this project. In addition, I also gained experience of AWS EC2 and DynamoDB when working on the project.

Membership account stack migration (January 2017 - June 2017)
As our legacy account stack could date back to around 2000, it was getting harder and harder to maintain. Therefore, we were assigned to work on the account stack migration. The legacy code base was written in PHP and C++, and we were asked to rewrite it to JAVA. I was focusing on OAuth and SAML protocols migration. During the project, I gained deeper understanding of RESTful API design, and understand when and how we could leverage the power of different HTTP methods and HTTP status codes.
To sum up, I grew a lot when doing the migration. I think the most important thing for me is that now I am not afraid of working on a huge complex code base and can read and understand such kind of code base quickly.

CI/CD dashboard (July 2016 - December 2016)
This is the first project I worked on after joining Yahoo. CI/CD dashboard is an internal dashboard displaying status and trend of multiple projects' build pipelines. I worked on full-stack for this project. We used Node.js as backend and MySQL as database, and the tech stack also includes Express.js, Gulp, Mocha, and Handlebars.

This summer, I interned at Trend Micro in Taiwan, which is an anti-virus company, and I was in Web Reputation Service (WRS) team. During the work, I am responsible of upgrading the internal URL rating service of the team. URL rating service is used to rate URL for the further usage. For example, the rating service can rate URL as a porn website, a phishing website, or other kinds of website. The original rating service is quite obsolete, and the raters were always complaining about the UI of the rating service, and the workflow of it truly makes them work inefficiently. At first, I found that the rating service was written in pure HTML, CSS, and Javascript, and what I did was to re-design the UI and used some new technologies (Jade, Sass, Coffeescript, Gulp, and Bootstrap) to develop the new rating service. In addition, we also wanted to add new functionalities to the rating service, so I added new APIs for the new service, and they were written in Python.

Before entering UIUC, I worked as a front-end developer at EZTABLE in Taiwan, which is a startup company similar to OpenTable. When working in EZTABLE, I was in Enterprise Solution (ES) team. ES team is responsible of business cooperation between EZTABLE and other companies such as credit card companies, food manufacturers, and restaurants, and I was responsible of developing the event websites for the cooperating events.

After graduating from National Taiwan University, I worked as a Research Assistant at Academia Sinica, which is a research institute in Taiwan. When I was in Academia Sinica, I was doing crowdsourcing research. I were involved in two projects, one is crowdsourcing in optical character recognition (OCR) data, and the other one is crowdsourcing in music tagging data. All two projects required me to develop websites for data collection, and used R for data analysis.
